chapterTitle: Some Lessons From Capital Market History

columns.text: In this exercise, we will determine the best estimate of future annual returns.

For calculation of the best forcast of future annual returns, we will use **Blume's formula**. This formula utilizes arithmetic and geometric average return to determine an anticipated return and can be written as follows:

$$\begin{aligned} \text{R}\left(\text{T}\right)&=\frac{\text{T}-1}{\text{N}-1}\times\text{Geometric return}+\frac{\text{N}-\text{T}}{\text{N}-1}\times\text{Aritmetic return}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

N = Number of years of data\
T = Number of years for which we are projecting future annual returns

Let's first identify the given variables in a problem:

|Variable |$\hspace{5pt}$Value| 
|--|--| 
|Years of data |$\hspace{8pt}$ 40 | 
|Aritmetic average return |$\hspace{5pt}$ 11.2% | 
|Geometric average return| $\hspace{7pt}$ 9.4%| 
| Years for projection of returns|5, 10, 20  |

**a)  5-year average return forecast**

Now, we will calculate the 5-year average return forecast:
$$\begin{aligned} \text{R}\left(\text{T}\right)&=\frac{\text{T}-1}{\text{N}-1}\times\text{Geometric average}+\frac{\text{N}-\text{T}}{\text{N}-1}\times\text{Arithmetic average}\\[15pt]
&=\frac{5-1}{40-1}\times9.4\%+\frac{40-5}{40-1}\times11.2\%\\[15pt]
&=0.102541\times9.4\%+0.897436\times11.2\%\\[15pt]
&=0.964103\%+10.051282\%\\[15pt]
&=\boxed{\bf11.015385\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$

**The best estimate of the future annual returns over 5 years determined based on Blum's formula is 11.02 percent.**

**b)  10-year average return forecast**

Next, let's calculate the 10-year average return forecast:
$$\begin{aligned} \text{R}\left(\text{T}\right)&=\frac{\text{T}-1}{\text{N}-1}\times\text{Geometric average}+\frac{\text{N}-\text{T}}{\text{N}-1}\times\text{Arithmetic average}\\[15pt]
&=\frac{10-1}{40-1}\times9.4\%+\frac{40-10}{40-1}\times11.2\%\\[15pt]
&=0.230769\times9.4\%+0.769231\times11.2\%\\[15pt]
&=2.169229\%+8.615385\%\\[15pt]
&=\boxed{\bf10.784614\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$

**The average return forecast over 10 years calculated based on Blum's formula is 10.78 percent.**

**c)  20-year average return forecast**

Now, let's determine the 20-year average return forecast:
$$\begin{aligned} \text{R}\left(\text{T}\right)&=\frac{\text{T}-1}{\text{N}-1}\times\text{Geometric average}+\frac{\text{N}-\text{T}}{\text{N}-1}\times\text{Arithmetic average}\\[15pt]
&=\frac{20-1}{40-1}\times9.4\%+\frac{40-20}{40-1}\times11.2\%\\[15pt]
&=0.487179\times9.4\%+0.0.512821\times11.2\%\\[15pt]
&=4.579483\%+5.743590\%\\[15pt]
&=\boxed{\bf10.323073\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$

**The best estimate of the future annual returns over 20 years is 10.32 percent.**
**To conclude, the best estimates of the future annual returns over 5 years, 10 years, and 20 years are 11.02 percent, 11.78 percent, and 10.32 percent, respectively.**
